job_title: Benefits Outreach Specialist in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Opportunity to grow, team environment
cons: Interviews for internal hires can be strenuous

review_title: Mission Driven Workplace with Supportive Employees That Strive to Help the Community
pros: BDT is an amazing workplace. Our mission is to help individuals get access to public benefits. This company is an outstanding organization that gives great purpose for work. Through my time here at BDT, I've improved a vast amount of my professional and personal skills. My department and others here at BDT work efficiently to provide accurate work and are always there to help with whatever is needed.
cons: It's a smaller organization started in 2005 that is now starting to integrate newer systems to help employees work efficiency and effectively. Not much of a con but innovation is big part of the job on the admin side.

pros: Had free lunch paid for by employees
cons: Employees get free lunch aswel

review_title: Empathy Meets Technology -- Helping People Access Public Benefits
job_title: Benefits Outreach Specialist in Philadelphia, PA
pros:
BDT is a rewarding workplace with kind and compassionate staff that focuses on taking the human element into account for everything. From the way we treat our clients to the way the organization supports its workers, BDT is a very people-forward organization.

As a Benefits Outreach Specialist, I get to use the customer service skills I honed at other entry-level jobs in order to make a tangible difference in people's lives by helping them obtain multiple public benefits with a single call. I found this to be a great step forward from other less satisfying or lower-paying customer service jobs.

Above and beyond the monetary compensation, BDT also offers benefits as well as other kinds support and encouragement to its Benefits Outreach Specialists to help us live happy lives separate from our time in the office.

BDT helps an expanding number of US States with their benefits programs, resulting in periods of fast company growth and new roles for people to be promoted to.

The most wonderful part of the day-to-day at BDT are the people we work with: we pride ourselves on being a team of compassionate people who have a strong desire to help. BDT provides the training and technology for each of us to really make a difference in individual people's lives!
cons:
Benefits Outreach Specialist is a client-facing customer service role, we talk to some people in difficult circumstances, which can have an impact on especially sensitive people. Challenging calls do happen from time to time. Thankfully, BDT offers different kinds of support to everyone in these roles.

Learning your particular State's public benefits is an ongoing process, since laws and regulations may change. BDT provides ongoing training and tips to help with this.

Call workload may fluctuate with seasons or crises, for example when there is an emergency like the pandemic increasing the number of people who need help.

Work from home model may be a challenge to some people in certain circumstances.

review_title: Simply The Best!! Better than all the Rest!!
job_title: Benefits Outreach Specialist in Philadelphia, PA
pros: BDT is an AMAZING job to work for!!! I look forward to logging in each day helping clients. The staff are very friendly and understanding. BDT is a place where you can grow and advance your career. Great culture!
cons: I have no cons to share.

job_title: Benefits Outreach Specialist in Philadelphia, PA
pros:
Coworkers are enthusiastic and cheerful, always trying to keep each other motivated and happy. 

The pay is good and they give a monthly internet stipend to help with internet costs from working from home. They also provide all the equipment to do the job and are quick to replace anything that doesn't work. 

Most of the clients that Benefits specialists deal with are positive and grateful for getting help they need.
cons:
They're expanding a lot with the government shutting a lot of pandemic benefits off, which means more calls per day and a bit more stressful of a day

Government agencies also decide they don't do any job that they can just direct people to us to not be able to do. So many more confused and irritated clients.

The amount of people also makes the chance of moving up within the company feel lower than they talked about when starting.

review_title: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times…
job_title: Benefits Outreach Specialist in Philadelphia, PA
pros:
Pay isn’t bad.

The mission of BDT is solid and being able to help out others is an incredible thing.

Working from home is great because there’s really no reason to have to go into the office, especially with Covid and Philly being so dangerous these days.
cons:
Clients can get very angry over the phone, yet you are still expected to assist them no matter what.

Co pay for health insurance could be better.

Can easily be burned out by call volume and traumatized by things you hear on the phone on a regular basis.

Having to still be on the phone after 5 pm because of translator or because BOS are still expected to take calls up to 5 (and some calls can be longer so being on the phone to 7 or even later happens on a daily basis).

Also, one term about the company overall: “toxic positivity”.

review_title: Great work culture; Supportive Team members
pros:
Supportive supervisors and peers.
Opportunities for growth.
Opportunities for professional development
Leadership helps remote working not feel so isolated by scheduling retreats/company wide Zoom parties"
Professional skills lessons to build portfolio/skills
cons: Low internal communication; however, when there is a discrepancy, team members work diligently to find common ground/solutions.

pros: Everyone here cares about doing better, for us and for our clients. It is a very collaborative and caring environment.
cons: Less pay due to non profit.

job_title: Benefits Outreach Specialist in Philadelphia, PA
pros:
-The people who work there are incredible for the most part. 
-Helping people.
-You gain a lot of knowledge.
cons:
-Emotional burnout 
-Pay is not enough 
-There’s definitely a class system between the call center and the admin population

review_title: BOS - Get in and Get Out
pros:
Great entry-level job to gain experience or if you are looking to reenter the workforce. 

Resume Builder.

Work from home.
cons:
I started working for BDT last year, right before the pandemic hit. They were extremely disorganized. The company sent the admin team home first and waited for almost two weeks to send home the BOS (Benefits Outreach Specialists) home. It made the BOS question how sincere the company was about its mission because it seemed like they could care less about the front-line workers. Thus the transition to working from home was not the smoothest. The BOS were sent home with desktops, and at first, a computer stipend was not supplied to us. 

Not to mention, as the other reviews have stated, the role is very stressful. Especially right now as a result of unemployment. Many of the client's stories can be emotionally taxing, and if you are not careful - it can trigger depression. 

The last thing I will say is that upward mobility can be quite challenging at this company. While being here, I have discovered that managers only hire their friends. I have seen many amazing BOS with an exponential amount of qualifications get passed over for an administration position, which is part of the reason why some of the BOS quit after working there for a short amount of time. Some of the people on the admin side had to leave and come back in order to get a better position. I say the only positive thing about this company is the flexibility to work from home, but who knows how long that will last with places gradually reopening and fewer restrictions in place.

pros: It's a great place to work with. The culture is unmatchable, everyone is friendly and kind
cons: On my experience nothing negative to add

review_title: A great organization, but not without its drawbacks
pros: A diverse group of talented and caring people contribute their skills to help improve people's lives and shape the organization for better. Has provided professional development and networking opportunities. Supportive through the pandemic and responsive to employee feedback.
cons: High level management can be out of touch with ground level operations and staff experience. Interdepartmental communication needs improvement. Oftentimes the organization prioritizes quick growth over preparedness and work can feel chaotic and confusing as a result.

pros: basically a 9-5 call center job. you can feel good you helped people end of day but still a call center. they provide computers and i got and internet stipend

review_title: Great mission, great people, great culture
pros:
BDT is a unicorn organization. It's the kind of place I always wanted to work for, but never thought I'd find. This is a great social impact organization with the most intelligent people I've ever worked with. The culture is diverse and inclusive - people make an effort to be kind and understanding of one another. You really can come to work as your authentic self! I love is how transparent the organization is. I always feel like I'm in the know of what's going on, what org goals are, and what our leadership team expects. Leadership seems to be receptive of suggestions for new ways of doing things.
Even working remotely, you can tell how much effort is put into trying to help everyone feel connected in a virtual environment. Another thing to love is how supportive and understanding leadership is during this uncertain time. We are constantly reminded to make sure we are taking care of ourselves and parents aren't judged when their children pop in during a Zoom call. I could go on and on...I can't say enough great things about this organization.
cons: None that I can think of.

review_title: Great place to work, very fast paced

-Integrated with other Philadelphia and national nonprofits creating a big footprint for impact
cons:
-Occasionally lacks direction from leadership
-Like other nonprofits, high demand from external parties and lack of ability to meet need due to capacity constraints

review_title: Amazing workplace that fosters professional development and is making a tangible impact!
pros:
- Work and collaborate with seasoned nonprofit professionals and industry leaders
- Multiple opportunities for professional development, project ownership, and leadership
- Meaningful work with tangible impact in the community 
- Great workplace culture 
- Dedicated efforts for cultural cohesion and diversity, equity, and inclusion 
- Organization balances between being a leading national nonprofit with still holding place for innovation and iterative improvement which then trickles down to encouraging employees to continue to grow and evolve alongside the organization
- Leadership is receptive to staff feedback and committed to improving the organization
- Work-life balance is encouraged
cons: This isn't a con but something to be mindful of is that this is a fast-paced and fast growing company. It's important to be open to and have the ability to adapt quickly as needed.

job_title: Financial Reporting Specialist in Philadelphia, PA

review_title: It can be a great place to work if it's the right fit for you
pros: The people that work here are all very friendly and nice to speak with. I enjoy working from home and the compensation is decent. I think that if you make a good effort to excel at your role they do offer opportunities to move up and/or take on new responsibilities. If you have good people skills and enjoy talking/working with people, this might be a good fit
cons: It can be stressful at times as some of the clients and/or situations can be very difficult. Also, the call volume can be a lot at times.

review_title: A non-profit that actually treats its employees well!
pros: Benefits Data Trust is a rare unicorn of a non-profit that not only has an important mission and does great work but also treats its employees well, prioritizing both competitive pay and organizational culture. This organization truly puts its people first, from its commitment to professional development and internal promotions to a work environment that encourages people to bring their full selves to their jobs. BDT's staff is incredibly diverse, and even in a remote environment, the organization is intentional about making sure people feel connected to the work and to each other.
cons: The organization is growing rapidly and there are some growing pains that go along with that.

pros: The leadership and staff treat you like a human beings, are aware (or becoming aware) of their blindspots and biases, and that's all you can ask for. People are reasonable enough that you can approach them with concerns and they will listen and address them.
cons: Like most companies, the management team has a lot more growth to do to set better examples for our team. Currently the managers are just trying to stay afloat, so they don't have as much time to think strategically about how be a better manager, how to improve the team's processes or team's professional development.

pros: Location, Pay, Culture, Management Cares. I have been at BDT for almost 5 years. The culture and the people make this a great place to work. Management works really hard at making you feel appreciated. This is like joining a family. Management is open minded and has always assisted me in striking the work /life that i needed. There a many opportunities to grow with the company by taking on a new position. If you are looking for an company that cares and goes out of its way to make you feel wanted and appreciated come join us.
cons: working from home and cant attend an in person party, but we had a virtual party that was great.

pros: Benefits Data Trust is a great organization that really cares for its staff. The culture that is built at BDT allows all staff members the opportunity to express oneself and encourages openness and communication at all levels. There are many opportunities for growth as BDT prioritize internal promotions first before reaching out externally. The organization was extremely helpful with the transition from working in office to remote by providing all the necessary resources needed to make the transition a success.
cons: Although the organization has made great stride this past year, wages and salary could improve a little bit more.

review_title: A great place to start your career. It's a nice mixture of data and politics.
pros: Great work environment and office comradery. Coworkers are pleasant to work with and everybody helps each other out. The work can be challenging depending on your team but also very meaningful.
cons:
Very low salaries for both the industry & DC.
Little effort is put in by upper management to retain good employees.
Employee training and development is nonexistent after your first week.

pros:
BDT is somewhere to find a place and name for yourself if you put in the effort. The environment is welcoming and inclusive and the staff truly have a shared mission. BDT has an abundant and thriving Contact Center offering amazing direct service to our clients, while other departments are continuously churning out work, presentations and recommendations to make the benefits access systems better. Together, they are a well-oiled machine! I can truly say that our mission is strong and that we stand by our goals. BDT has also begun to shift its focus to include a true racial equity lens and I'm excited to see it grow over the next few years. As BDT continues to grow, there are ample opportunities for employees to build their skills and determine their own career growth.

Most of all - It's easy to fall love with the culture at BDT that continues to thrive even through a pandemic! In 2020, the organization really supported its employees to make sure that they got home safe and were able to fully function in a remote working environment. Teams have been putting in effort to make sure that the exciting and fun culture of BDT continues to shine, even though we aren't in the office.
cons:
BDT is ever-changing. While that's wonderful that we continue to push the envelope and test the waters with good intentions for our clients, it's hard to keep up with! I wish we had time to slow down and pinpoint where we need better support and resources and how we can maintain this pace without over-burdening our workloads. Supervisors are supportive, but we could use some structural change to help in this area.

BDT is full of great minds and hearts. Sometimes in our passion to help clients, we forget to extend empathy to each other in the moment. We bounce back, but slowing down with the workload can help to alleviate some of this.

review_title: BDT is truly one of the most welcoming and most rewarding job environments.
job_title: Benefits Outreach Specialist in Philadelphia, PA
pros: I was onboarded during the midst of the pandemic, and one of the things that gravitated me towards applying for BDT was seeing initially just how much this company truly cares about their employees. They have stayed on top of the pandemic in terms of updating timelines for when we can be expected to SAFELY return to the office, all equipment (other than an internet router) is provided to successfully do your job, a stipend has been included in pay towards internet, and upon researching positions on LinkedIn...you will find tons of growth within this company in a relatively reasonable amount of time. Yes, this company does truly support you in your growth if you express interest and request the ability to learn more about the department you want to find yourself in. Also, while the job can be taxing at times, taking time for your own well-being is supported; whether that be through taking breaks as needed, as well as being encouraged to use your PTO time (something that was not the case at my prior job). Despite being fully virtual, BDT does a great job at providing the resources to make us feel as connected as possible.
cons: When you are initially starting as a BOS, being scheduled only for calls can be difficult, however this is where I encourage to express interest in learning new things and taking on new responsibilities because they WILL support it when/where possible, and it's an effective way to break up your day instead of it feeling repetitive. One of the larger main cons with working from home is the inability to see people as they are working, so lately BDT is a little more "watchful eye" on the BOS employees which can feel stressful at times or like you are being questioned. However, almost all of our communication is through instant messaging which plays a factor, and just being communicative about what you're doing is an easy way to remedy this. Communication can be difficult, but for being entirely virtual with all of the tech issues that come with being virtual, the company still stands strong. Lastly, there is the possibility that you can be stuck on a call past your scheduled hours. This is a particular problem lately due to the frequency of it happening, and I hope a solution is implemented to fix this for the agreed scheduled hours.

job_title: Benefits Outreach Specialist in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Great Company overall. All the people are so nice and inviting. I have had great experiences. Also they do alot of internal hiring and you have a better chance of getting internal jobs because u see them before they post them to everyone, which is good to get a promotion. The job is on the phone which can be positive when someone tells you how much you changed their situation and they tell you your the only person that has been able to help in the past months
cons: Being on the phone can be taxing and draining at times

pros: Competitive pay, great leadership, extremely inclusive and collaborative environment, generous PTO and Holidays
cons: Reactive industry to political and economic changes, can be fast-paced

pros: Supportive team and supervisor. Always there to answer questions
cons: Really bad medical benefits. They help people enroll in medical assistance but can't ensure that their own employees have good health insurance. Low pay, you can't make a living with what they pay. Not even as a full time employee

job_title: Benefits Outreach Specialist in Philadelphia, PA
pros: The people at BDT are amazing and inspiring, a passionate, fun, inclusive environment. With things like virtual events, and morning zoom huddles, employee resource groups, and fun/themed slack channels, we’ve stayed connected since transitioning to virtual at the start of the pandemic.
cons: The pandemic has caused increased call volume, and a higher proportion of calls from people who are really struggling. It is rewarding to be able to help people in these situations, but can also be challenging mentally and emotionally, and self care is very important.

pros: Great environment with great staff
cons: Pay and clients on the phone

review_title: BDT is a great community and workplace!
pros: Everyone who works at BDT is extremely kind, open, dedicated, and hard working. It is an amazing group of people and an indescribable culture that allows its employees to grow and connect. Everyone is so dedicated to the mission of providing access to underserved individuals that it creates excitement to come to work everyday. The benefits and work/life balance are great. I would definitely recommend BDT as an organization.
cons: I can't really think of any cons, but if I had to chose one I might say the pay could be a bit higher, but this is expected because it is a nonprofit.

job_title: Benefits Outreach Specialist in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Very progressive leadership with fairly new CEO and CFO. They have grown the organization expeditiously. There has been a lot of growth in positions within BDT. I think BDT will continue to progress with the current leadership.
cons: Everyone has their own personal cons which I will keep personal. The obvious cons for the Benefits Outreach Specialist position: 1. Constant sitting; 2. Dealing with difficult clients and remaining calm..

pros: BDT genuinely cares about its employees. In my experience, they seek to provide opportunities for career advancement for all its staff. The people are also amazing. I enjoy coming to work every day because my co-workers are always approachable. Everyone seems to galvanize around the company's mission of helping improve the community through benefits access. I would absolutely refer a friend/family member.
cons: The pay can be better, but that is to be expected in non-profit. BDT does, however, provide me with great benefits (medical, dental, 401k, PTO) and an annual salary increase.

job_title: Benefits Outreach Specialist in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Everything about our organization is Awesome. The people I work around is Family. We have the same mission to help others in need .That's what makes this company Unique and the best company I ever worked for.
cons: I have none and that's the truth!

review_title: A company that cares  for its clients and employees
pros: BDT genuinely cares for their clients. They are treated fairly and with compassion. The work environment is caring and community like. The referral program is great. Employees' input is taken into consideration when making decisions. Good benefits.
cons: Professional development path needs more support

review_title: BOS is a very difficult position
job_title: Benefits Outreach Specialist in Philadelphia, PA

This is a very emotionally draining position. You will need a therapist if you work this role. Be ready to feel like a punching bag.

pros: Community Based Organization with a sincere efficient approach to assisting citizens with various programs. Very fulfillling positions if you have a passion for helping people. Also focus on employee with a decent starting pay, generous pay & PTO .

Coworkers and supervisors are very supportive
the culture at BDT is great. also it is a company that allows you to grow profesionally
